ftbquests.chapter.adventures_in_abydos.q: I hope the sand doesn't get in your machines.
One step closer to home...
A new world!
The core component for crafting all components for §4UHV§r.
A new machine that can find treasures among the rubble.
1st §4§oUltimate§r Multiblock

By inputting a bacteria you are able to breed then so they multiply and get mutated copies so you can try to find the exact rates you are looking for. Higher mutability means more variance in its output.
This is how you can extract the bacteria to get the resources you desire
This machine can do 3 things.
1. Reactivate the Dormant Bacteria to a usable form
2. Mutate bacteria so that it may have a new affinity
3. Mutate bacteria so that it may be a new type
With all of this and the breeder (more information there) you should be able to get the exact type of bacteria you desire.
Go Explore the Scattered Temples of Abydos to find the things you are searching for.
You might even find a §ltalisman§r powerful enough to stop the sands of Abydos from eroding you...
Scattered Temples

Otherworldly Biology
Awoken Bacteria. These come in all kinds of types and seem to produce some familiar liquids.

This beauty can harvest colossal amounts of air at once, and then also automatically distill it. Without a doubt, this multiblock is a must for getting to Ancient Gate.

The core of an Ancient Stargate.

ftbquests.chapter.applied_energistics.qu: Terminals allow you to see what is happening inside your network, and interact with it.
We recommend instantly upgrading to a crafting terminal, as they are extremely convenient.
Patterns are the key to autocrafting with AE2.
They store the recipes that you want to craft, and when you put them in a pattern provider, AE2 will see how to craft that item.
Now that you have access to LuV circuits, you can craft 1M components with a cheaper recipe.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest10: Better get used to it, as it will take a little bit until you can get better ones.
A §oBIG§r barrel that can scale with your power allowing you to barrel even harder.
Heavy Oil can alternatively be made in a Pyrolyse Oven
Carbon and a Plastic. Each Plastic gives twice as much Fibers as the previous one.

ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest11: The new §6HV§r circuit can be upgraded into an §5EV§r circuit, allowing you to make upgrades to all your machines.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest13: Better Circuits means better Circuit boards
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest14: §6Auto Maintenance Hatch§r: Ever worry about needing maintenance, well now you never have to.
§3Configurable Maintenance Hatch§r: Make your machines faster at the sake of risking more maintenance issues, or make them slower to reduce the chance.
Maintenance hatches will always check if they incur maintenance which can take a toll on your game's performance at scale. Auto Maintenance Fixes this concern.

Alternatively the Configurable Maintenance can range from .9x time to 1.1x time. Meaning you can either add/subtract 10%% from a recipe time. Reducing long recipe times is very nice. Increasing Generator uptime is also very nice.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest15: §6HV§r Assembler, used for §6HV§r Energy Hatches and Upgrade Kits, along with SMD's for cheaper circuit crafting.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest17: This Chip is used to make §6HV§r Energy Hatches and Transformers.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest18: The first upgrade to every circuit component. Is more resource efficient and gives more per craft.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest19: Will increase the power of anything thermal by 24x.
Lets you turn your RF into §6HV§r power.

ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest21: Can be upgraded into a Large Autoclave soon.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest22: Armor with build in night vision and step assist.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest23: The Cleanroom is a structure that filters inside itself, allowing for a dust free environment to achieve more precise crafting.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest24: §5EV§r Circuits give you access to the §6HV§r Circuit Assembler. I recommend putting this in your Cleanroom to save time.

§6HV§r superconductor, can hold 16 amps on the 1x cable.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest30: 3rd tier of coils for your EBF to allow you to increase the heat even more. Will start making hot ingots more often.
It also gives you your first heat based Overclocks for Aluminium and Stainless Steel notably.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest32: Will increase the power of anything thermal by 48x. This is the final Upgrade Kit you can make for them.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest33: You should understand what this does already right?
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest34: This cools down your Hot Ingots better and faster then the Chemical Bath could ever hope to achieve.

Single block Distilleries can still be used but won't give you all products and can't be overclocked.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest37: More Information in the Resource Production Tab
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest38: Allows you to pump oil from the void. I don't know how that works out, but it does.
Better Drills do not drain chunks as much and work much faster.

Spoilers, it's going to be oil.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest40: Mix Oil distillation byproducts with some hydrogen to clean them, allowing you to distill them further.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest41: Choose an oil byproduct and get it cracked to allow even further processing.
Taking some time to figure out which cracking method for what product is the best for you is recommended.
Note: Chemical Reactors can be used for cracking but are less efficient.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest42: I hope you like having many distillation towers.

ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest44: Allows you to run your multiblocks off of pure §5EV§r power, or even overclock to §9IV§r.

This needs Ruthenium, which you get from the Platline, check it out in the "Processing Lines" chapter.

ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest51: This hatch can do something called Speed Overclocking.
A Speed Overclock is a special kind of Overclocking, that makes your machine run recipes at the next tier of voltage.
However, unlike normal Overclock, it will not make the machine be able to do recipes at that higher tier.
As an example, a 4A §5EV§r Hatch will let a machine run at §9IV§r speed, but only do §5EV§r or lower recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest52: A 16A §5EV§r Energy Hatch will let a machine run at §dLuV§r speed, but only do §5EV§r or lower recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest53: Second tier of Boule. Can be used to make new types of chips as well as make older types more efficiently.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest55: Acquired from Apatite or Monazite processing.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest57: Can be done with some fancy mixing or Mystical Agriculture.

ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest70: The spoils from the massive epoxy processing line.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest71: A different way to make chips, by covering them in chemicals.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest73: These chips will be needed in almost every other circuit from now on, might want to keep a lot of these in stock.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest74: Lets you power your multiblocks with §9IV§r or overclock to §dLuv§r.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest75: §9IV§r Assembly Machine, used to make higher tier Coils and Energy Hatches. Can be upgraded into the Assembly Machine multiblock's controller.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest79: Lets you turn your RF into §9IV§r power.
This is the final version of the §bMV§r circuit, however just like the §7LV§r circuit, there is a cheaper recipe that unlocks later on.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest80: §9IV§r superconductor, can hold 64 amps in a 1x cable.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest82: This Chip is used in both §9IV§r and §dLuV§r Energy Hatches and Transformers as well as Assembly Line Casings.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest83: The second upgrade to all the Circuit Components. Very resource efficient and is needed for high tier Circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest84: These will give you the heat to make HSS-E and HSS-S ingots. That's not going to get confusing at all.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest85: The first High Speed Steel available.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest87: A denser and harder form of HSS.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest89: This multiblock allows you to create even more complex alloys, but will give outputs in a molten form.
The ABS performs both mixing and smelting, producing multiple ingot units (144 mB each) while requiring only 75%% of the time compared to its EBF counterpart.
You will need to cool the Molten Liquids in a Vacuum Freezer.
This is the final version of the §7LV§r circuit, however with a bit more progression you will gain access to an even cheaper recipe for it.
ftbquests.chapter.automation_age.quest90: The Nuclear Reactor can be used to transform §8Thorium§r into §aUranium§r and §2Uraniums§r into §cPlutoniums§r. Additionally it produces quite a lot of power.
Make sure that your dynamo hatches are big enough.
Oh, and maybe look into paralleling this thing when you can, you could say it causes quite the reaction.

ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest1.desc: The start of any skyblock pack. Who wood have guessed.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest10.des: It is recommended to make more dirt, before using up your entire starter island on this useful resource.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest11.des: The spoils of war when a string mesh is involved!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest12.des: With all the parts combined, you finally get your hands on your first §7LV§r circuit! It might be a good idea to make a bunch of these beforehand, to aid in the push for §7LV§r machines.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest14.des: Superconductors are lossless, meaning they won't lose power the farther they go. Always use them, when possible.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest15.des: Create's number one alloy, now with a better crafting ratio!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest16.des: Tired of needing two ingots per plate? The Mechanical Press lets you make plates for half the price early on!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest17.des: Extracting Latex from §lJungle Trees§r will be one of your first sources of rubber, after a bit of processing.
There are 2 ways to do this, either by placing §nArboreal Extractors§r around a Jungle Tree or by building the §nLatex Plantation§r multiblock.
By combining Rubber and Sulfur you can get cured rubber.
- This can be done by using a heated Create mixer.
- This can be done by using a Steam Alloy Smelter.
- This can be done by using a Cooking Pot with a campfire under it.

§nNote§r: For the Latex Plantation you can use a wooden tap in the controller block, to use the better tap methods with a fuel and circuit you'll need a §8ULV§r Input Bus at a minimum. An Output Hatch can be placed on the back to automate further but isn't needed.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest18.des: Every greg master needs their toolbelt fully stocked to get their first machines ready. We recommend starting with Iron or Wrought Iron tools, or taking a look at the shop!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest19.des: Wrought Iron is made by sizzling iron on a campfire or stove.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest2.desc: Converters are essential for power transfer in this pack, as they are used to convert between EU and FE/RF. EU conversion is disabled for StarT, so you will need one of these whenever energy conversion is necessary. Keep in mind that §a4 FE/RF§r is equal to §61 EU§r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest20.des: By heating a mixer, you can start to make your first alloys.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest21.des: Rubber is an important material, used for coating wires.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest22.des: Barrel transformations from Ex Nihilo have been disabled, and replaced with this beautiful machine!
It can soak, compost, and transform.
Be sure to choose the correct "§n§o§7Active Machine Mode§r", in the tab on the left of the UI.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest23.des: This bad boy will make you steel, albeit slowly. It isn't possible to automate sadly, but there is a better version on the horizon.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest24.des: It is recommended to use Wrought Iron for your steel processing, as it cuts the recipe time down by a noticeable amount.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest25.des: The most valuable alloy you can make right now, due to how much you will need for circuits.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest26.des: Things are going to get sticky when using the Slitake Spores.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest27.des: Let's ignore the fact that this circuit board is just a plank of wood with some cables stuck to it with glue.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest28.des: Every circuit needs some resistors to stop it from blowing up in your face.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest29.des: Making glass isn't as simple as smelting sand now. First, you must grind down some Sand and Flint, mix it together into Glass Dust, and then give it a sizzle on a campfire.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest3.desc: Breaking leaves with a crook will drop Silkworms, which can be used on leaves to infest them. Sit back, watch the infestation spread, and reap the rewards with your crook.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest30.des: Let's put that steel to good use. You may want to hold off on making too many of these, at least before getting a lathe.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest31.des: By combining Witch Water and Sand together, you can make your first Soul Sand. You can either repeat this, or invest in a §3Soul Campfire§r to bulk haunt more Soul Sand and other materials.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest32.des: If you think the amount of different alloys are bad right now, then just you wait.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest33.des: Gold has a few uses for making Create components and machines, and is used for some alloys in §7LV§r
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest34.des: Now that you have some Brass, you can construct a new multiblock to process your ores further.
This will give you access to important resources, like gold and nickel.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest35.des: Pop this next to two water sources and you will never be thirsty again.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest36.des: Chuck your spare saplings into a Composter for some bonemeal. This will be necessary to obtain lava.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest37.des: Lava gives you access to cobblestone, which will contain everything you might ever need in life. You could also use it as a fuel, no one here is judging you.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest38.des: A staple of any GregTech pack. Upgrade your coal into coke, and get some tasty creosote to coat your planks in.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest39.des: Needing lots of crops quickly? Then this multiblock has your back!
You might get some good use out of this when making Bio Diesel.
You can optionally use buses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interact directly with the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest4.desc: Sieving is the only way to obtain resources early on. They can be automated, with a little cleverness.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest40.des: A larger barrel means faster recipes! Maybe this will help with that slime addiction...
You can optionally use buses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interact directly with the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest41.des: Automatic pebbles and lava? Making a few of these sounds like a good use of your time.
You can optionally use buses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interact directly with the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest42.des: By combining dirt and gravel into Coarse Dirt and sieving it, you can double your dirt, and you even have a chance to get some of the gravel back!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest43.des: Create stresses me out, but without that nothing would move.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest44.des: Since Blazes are out of the question, a Basic Burner is needed to heat Basins.
Note that you can §6superheat§r Basic Burners with an Encased Fan at max §3RPM§r, though it will burn through fuel faster (32x).
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest45.des: Diesel Engines are a great way to generate large amounts of Stress Units for Create machines. Bio Diesel is one of the best fuel sources, but it requires some automating to keep a steady supply.
You can produce Ethanol using either the Basin Lid or the Casket. The Basin Lid is 1.5x faster, whilst the Casket is simpler to work with.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest46.des: Early fluid storage that can push and pull fluids. It accepts upgrades that can dramatically increase the storage capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest47.des: Create gives you access to your first alloys, though at a poorer ratio than later methods. While good in the early game, you will want to upgrade once you hit §7LV§r.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest48.des: By putting in a bucket of lava and pumping water in, the Stone Barrel is able to produce you as much cobble as your heart desires. Just be sure to select the correct "ghost circuit", which can be done in the bottom right of the machine's interface.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest49.des: Witch Water can be made in a Wooden Barrel with Mycelium Spores and Water.
Make sure that your Wooden Barrel is on "§n§o§7Barrel Transformation§r" mode. Refer to the Barrel Transformation quest for more information.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest5.desc: Crucibles are handy devices that turn saplings into water, only to be discarded moments later. Using a bucket made of logs, you can magically scoop up this vital liquid.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest50.des: Nickel is a base material used in quite a few alloys. Getting a good amount early on will definitely be beneficial.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest51.des: Using Crushing Wheels, you can automate gravel and sand. Crushing wheels have a set amount of time they need to process their items (based on their RPM), but can process up to a stack of items at a time. Smart Chutes are an easy way to pump a stack of items in at a time.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest52.des: The Questbook takes you through the entire modpack, step by step. Here are a few things you should know:
§5-§r Mechanics: A small chapter explaining some GregTech mechanics
§5-§r Processing Lines: These chapters explain complicated processing lines
§5-§r Line of Progression: This chapter shows you all multiblocks and tiered items such as Coils
§5-§r Resource Production: This chapter shows you how to get MOST of the raw resources you will need
§5-§r Quality of Life: This chapter unveils some helpful mods and features that exist to make the pack more enjoyable
If a Quest doesn't load/register try rejoining.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest53.des: An alternative to the mixer from create.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest54.des: A much needed upgrade to steel production. It's faster, and can be automated!
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest55.des: While Tempered Glass is typically made in an Arc Furnace, it can be made in a Stone Barrel with Lava and Glass.
It will be needed to make the Rock Filtrator which is what gates the Arc Furnace.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest56.des: The building-block of any primitive machine.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest59.des: A Primitive Ore Factory upgraded for speed and power.
Not only does it use steam to power over pesky coals but it can perform recipes in parallel using steam.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest6.desc: By sneaking and right-clicking Grass (the dirt one), you can get pebbles for basic stone types.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest60.des: While not required for progression, you'll no longer have to mix and §nTHEN§r smelt. Now it'll be in a single step.
If you are using steam machines, make sure to check EMI/JEI to see what other you could make use of. They can be quite handy if you don't have §7LV§r machines yet.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest61.des: There are many machines which can use steam to do your desired task even before you have voltage.
Steam can be produced by Boilers either §7Low Pressure§r or §8High Pressure§r.
Alternatively you can use thermal boilers which can be made by right clicking a dynamo with a steam pipe.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest62.des: The literal building bricks to your designs.
Dust to Clay Blocks in a Barrel is a quick and easy solution to all of you masonry pursuits.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest63.des: Larger versions of their single block counter-parts able to make use of steam parallels.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest64.des: Early on you can produce steam using solid fuels like charcoal, liquid fuels like creosote, or §e§lTHE SUN§r §o(only during the day)§r. High Pressure burns faster for higher Steam/tick.
High Pressure and Low Pressure Steam Machines can run most §8ULV§r and §7LV§r recipes at the cost of steam instead of power making them a nice addition to your arsenal.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest67.des: A §o§lMUCH§r better composter that allows you to do thing and bulk with easier automation.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest68.des: The building-block of your first wood oven.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest7.desc: The materials you can acquire from Blackstone are needed to progress. It might be a good idea to automate this.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest70.des: A campfire on steroids for you early §nGlass§r and §nWrought Iron§r needs.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest71.des: A Kiln but now with the power for even easier automation and in mass.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest72.des: While consuming more steam than their earlier counter-parts (if at all), they are able to run multiple of the same recipe at once with no extra cost or time making it a great feature for bulk processing early on.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest73.des: Ever feel like you should be able to build more with effortless building, well consume these to increase your reach.
§4Warning§r: Upgrade can be lost on death or relog in some instances so having some in a chest isn't a horrible idea.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest74.des: The Casket is a machine that allows for easy Ethanol production.
Alongside that, it can also produce various brews, that gives beneficial effects when consumed.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest75.des: A slightly more complicated way of making rubber, that does not depend on latex.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest76.des: Machines from vintage open up many interesting opportunities for more efficient material processing, alongside primitive ore processing.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.quest77.des: This pack is designed to be played in §nPeaceful§r, hope you enjoy.
ftbquests.chapter.early_game.title: Early Game
First LuV Circuit
Convert RF into §dLuV§r Amps
The heart of every §dLuV§r machine.
Your §dLuV§r Superconductor
QuarkTech armor is really nice. You can run and fly faster, toggle night vision and eat automatically.
You can also now hold Hot Ingots without dying.
This one has a built-in Jetpack.
The core material for §dLuV§r.
Paralleling allows you to do more batches of a recipe at once.
Read More About It Here
4x Parallel Hatch
The Power Substation is the endgame power storage. You might not need it yet in LuV, but later on you §lwill§r need this.
The structure itself does not store power, the capacitor blocks placed inside the station are what gives it storage capability.
Because of this, you can keep upgrading the substation as you progress through the pack, up until UHV.
When you reach UHV, you can craft the Ultimate Capacitor, which can store a *small* amount of power.
This is what you will use to make more advanced components and machines.
Inputs must be placed in THAT order and only in §8ULV§r input buses.
If something has multiple unstackables, a forming press with a rename is a good way to differentiate the item in inputs.
Assembly Line and Research Begins
Smash elements to get more powerful materials
Fusion Glass isn't a horrible idea
&4To copy \& paste a fusion reactor, first turn it off, otherwise you will brick your world!
This is the final Circuit Assembler you'll make.

It can later be upgraded into a Large Circuit Assembling Facility, which accepts only a single Energy Hatch. This allows access to Circuit Assemblers of a higher voltage tier before getting the next tier of Circuits.
§5EV§r Input and Output for the Substation.
EV Substation Hatches
An alloy made out of precious metals.
Now that you have the big Circuit Assembler, you can use this to instantly get access to §dLuV§r Circuit Assembler recipes.
Get used to making all your components in an Assembly Line, because it will not change.
Allows you to store research data in mass and share it among multiple Assembly Lines or other Data Banks.
This multiblock provides computation to the research station. By playing around with components, you can generate enough computation to research things.
48§3CWU§r is the maximum sustainable early on with no bridging component.
36§3CWU§r is the maximum sustainable with a bridging component.
48§3CWU§r is the maximum sustainable with Abydos technology and a bridging component.
Bridging explained further in the following Quest:
Network Switch
Scanner are not powerful enough to research high tier technologies. This multiblock can research almost anything!
Used for the final Data Stick scans, and can be upgraded into a Research Station.
Your first fusion product. Passiving this isn't a bad idea, as it will be the only thing you will really use your MK I Fusion Reactor for.
A SoC that makes crystal circuits cheaper.
Third and last EV Circuit
A crystal processor, using crystals to transmit data with light rays.
A more refined Crystal Chip, ready to be used for computing.
A raw crystal etched in Europium to be used as a base for crystalline circuits.
You should have some of this from your ore proc.
§oYou did passive your ore proc... right?§r
This can be used for looping your crystal chips, so you don't need a ton of emeralds.
Fourth and Last IV Circuit
Third LuV Circuit
Second ZPM Circuit
First UV Circuit
A stronger fiber-based circuit board, made by layering multiple normal ones over each other.
Third IV Circuit
The second tier Parallel Hatch.
16x Parallel Hatch
The first step into making computers think.
.... Is it just me or did it just look back?
It's alive?
Fourth and Last LuV Circuit
The basis of cell reproduction.
All these alloys and their names make you go crazy. Seriously, how do you pronounce some of those names?
WDYM they get "§obetter§r"........
Second UV Circuit
Third ZPM Circuit
The second tier of Fusion Reactors.
Each tier of Fusion Reactors overclocks recipes below it and has higher heat capacity to allow for more fusion recipes to be run.
A precious metal made with 3 types of expensive resources. Used for §cZPM§r Field Generators and the second tier of Fusion Reactors.
Second LuV Circuit
The core §cZPM§r material.
Your §cZPM§r Superconductor
The 6th tier of Coils
These will get replaced quite quickly by Trinium.
The 7th tier of Coils
It is worth getting all your EBF's to it, as the heat will save quite some energy.
§cZPM§r recipe speeds.
§3UV§r recipe speeds, what a bargain.
§3UV§r recipe speeds.
§4UHV§r recipe speeds.
Even more parallels on your machine. If it hasn't happened yet, these will now definitely outpace your perfect overclock cubes.
64x Parallel Hatch
This beautiful machine allows you to compress entire processing lines into one machine.
First ZPM Circuit
Used for active transformers and in some other crafting recipes such as wire superconductor.
This Chip is gonna be used for Gate Machines, Fusion Reactors and Energy Hatches.
UHPIC Chips
The core §3UV§r material.
The heart of every §3UV§r machine.
Tritanium is a material you are gonna need a ton of. If you have the Fusion Reactors, consider setting some on passive if you have the time.
This is a material used for §3UV§r components and machines of §4UHV§r tier and beyond.
§3UV§r power for all your machines.
This Maintenance Hatch tricks your machines into believing they are in normal Cleanrooms, allowing you to run cleanroom recipes outside of one.
Time for some fancy new Chips.
This is gonna be the final tier of Coils until you can reach Abydos. Swapping out all of your older Coils is recommended, because you will need the speed.
Qubit Chips
§4UHV§r recipe speeds.
§aUEV§r recipe speeds.
A new Boule, that unlocks new chips, and makes the older ones even cheaper.
Your §3UV§r Superconductor
This material is used for some of the most important §4UHV§r machines.
A fusion material made with MK I Fusion Reactors. It had basically no use up until now, but that is about to change.
positioner
These can replace your old Cleanroom Filters, and turn it into a Sterile Cleanroom. Do keep in mind that normal Cleanroom recipes do not work inside a Sterile Cleanroom
It wasn't clean enough
Sterile Cleanroom
Unfortunately, you can connect only one HPCA to the research station. However, this multiblock can route the computation from several HPCAs into the research station!
HPCAs will need bridging components to be able to connect and transmit CWU through these.
A machine capable of tearing space-time using the power of Nether Stars, allowing you to harvest Naquadah from it.
§cZPM§r power for all your machines.
Used in fusion reactors to heat up atoms allowing them to fuse together.
Used for early research with the scanner.
Finally, you can upgrade your resource generation with Parallel Hatches.
Parallel Resource Production
§cZPM§r superconductor, can hold 96 amps in a 1x cable.
§dLuV§r superconductor, can hold 64 amps in a 1x cable.
§3UV§r superconductor, can hold 48 amps in a 1x cable.
Prismalium is not the only §3UV§r superconductor. There is also Melodium, which is shown in the next quest chapter.
Solidify your Epoxy in a more durable manner.
A stronger §nData Orb§r capable of knowing the most complex ordeals in this realm.
A way to monitor your multiblocks with §credstone§r outputs allowing for complex systems.
The heart of every §cZPM§r machine.
Used to store patterns for the Assembly Line.
Used Here
A parallel freezer. Great for when you have a lot of EBF's. Also matches up great with the RHF you will get later.
Futuristic Mechanisms
Gives you plates at a 1:1 ratio.
This can crush down all the things you'll need, keep in mind you'll need one at §6HV§r to get the byproducts.
This can be used for automating gravel, sand and dust.
Precise item moving across machines.
Can move items in and out of a machine, without needing extra blocks.
The assembler is an advanced crafting machine, that can make a ton of items for cheaper.
With Energy Hatches you can now power massive machines to do your bidding.
Can cut blocks into plates, and rods into bolts at a 1:4 ratio. This also unlocks Diamond GT Tools, which have a lot more durability.
Your first Cutting Saw, made out of Cobalt Brass.
Cutting Saws will always use alloys that require some work, but are definitely worth the investment.
Cobalt Dust can acquired through either Cobaltite Sludge, the Electric Ore Factory, or simply washing Copper Ore.
1 ingot into 2 wires, a better bargain can't be made.
Using the force of spinny things, this machine separates liquids, gasses and items.
Can move fluids in and out of a machine without needing extra blocks.
Collects Air at circuit 1, which can be centrifuged for Nitrogen and Oxygen. If you need a lot of Oxygen, it is recommended to use a different way, check the Processing Lines chapter for reference.
This can be used for cheaper gears, and making hardened glass.
Turns item into their liquid forms.
Useful for separating items into their base forms.
You'll need to process some diamond ore for this.
Operates using Oxygen, and can recycle machines into ingots.
Used to upgrade all Thermal machine stats by 6x.
Very useful to use on:
- Dynamos
- Energy Cells
- Fluid Cells
- Aqueous Accumulators
- Igneous Extruders
Gives you 2 rods per ingot.
Super Chests grant massive storage capacity, offering some more utility than just drawers.
The Electric Blast Furnace (EBF for short) is a better furnace, which you will need for most of your ingots going forward. If you are curious about how to use the EBF for §bMV§r recipes
Click Here
Electric Blast Furnace (EBF)
Your §bMV§r superconductor.
This is your §bMV§r material, will be needed in vast quantities.
A good first source of Aluminium is Sapphire(s) or Sodalite.
Once you are in §bMV§r, you can set up Clay Electrolysis for easier Aluminium.
A good source of Arsenic.
§oVoid Extractor §nor§r§o Rock Filtrator can be used to obtain.
A binding catalyst for making Boules.
Processing Sphalerite is going to be the best source of Gallium for a long time.
Another type of component for circuits used in §bMV§r and above.
Boules can be cut into Wafers, which will be core ingredients for most of your Circuits and Energy Hatches from now on.
Every boule needs to be cut down into wafers for further processing.
Gives metals magnetic charge. Also functions as an energizer.
The material for your next Cutting Blade.
The §bMV§r Cutter can cut Wafers from Silicon Boules, which are used for better circuit recipes.
The heart of every §bMV§r machine.
This converter makes §bMV§r power, instead of §7LV§r.
Wafers are kinda useless on their own. You can inscribe them with the Laser Engraver and a colored lens, making them more useful.
Made with either Sodium Persulfate or Iron III Chloride. Both are explained in the Processing Lines chapter.
First §bMV§r circuits.
Makes all your Circuits going forward, and makes the older ones for a lower price.
An instant tree farm.
Used primarily for making Charcoal and Coal Coke.
Can replace your Coke Oven as a source of Creosote.
A §7LV§r component that's used everywhere.
Cheaper §7LV§r Circuit.
Second LV Circuit
Cheaper §bMV§r Circuit.

Any Red Lenses
IC Chips

Any Blue Lenses
ULPIC Chips
These can be used to overclock your EBF again, this time to §6HV§r.
You should be starting to get the hang of it. A higher tier of machine, allowing for more recipes, and doing the previous ones faster.
Pretty straightforward
Super Tanks store a large amount of liquids.
However, they do need Polyethylene to be made. Check the Processing lines chapter for more information.
2x as efficient as the LV one.
For now the most useful material out of these is Neodymium, being used for higher tier Motors and Magnets.
Rare Earth Metals
Can be grown in the Autoclave from dust, or gotten by putting Purified Certus Quartz Ore through a Sifter.
AE2's backbone material
A faster and more advanced version of the Primitive Ore Factory, capable of handling higher tier ores.
Electric Ore Factory
Normally you would cool it down in a Vacuum Freezer, but that is still a little ways off.
Until then you can use the Chemical Bath to cool it down into the normal ingot.
Your first Hot Ingot
Hot Kanthal Ingot
This is your §6HV§r material, will be needed in vast quantities.
The next material for Coils.
It is not easy to get, but most definitely worth it.
Kanthal Coils are the second tier of coils.
Now you've cooled your first silicon ingots, you can finally make use of all the silicon that's lying about your base.
Use these to press plates into printed circuits.
Inscriber Presses
You are gonna need a lot of these, though they get more efficient the better wafers you have.
Printed Circuits
The machine allowing you to gather all the Geodes and Gems you could ever need.
You'll probably want two §7LV§r Output Buses to have enough room for the Geodes.
Note: This machine only supports a single Energy Hatch.
Uses Found Here:
Geodes
Gather ore from mining and collecting the dust around you.
Make sure to save the liquids for later as you can get more and rarer materials.
Note: This machine can only take a single Energy Hatch. Additionally, make sure you have enough output space: 2 §7LV§r Output Buses, and 2 §7LV§r Output Hatches will do the trick.
Use Found Here:
Void Extraction
Smelts alloys for cheaper.
Contains various precious resources that you will need later on.
The source for Vanadium, a metal primarily used in alloys.
Get Iron (III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate to etch your circuits.
One of the following quest needs to be completed:
Sodium Persulfate
Iron (III) Chloride

Stronger Chips used for Stronger Circuits all the way till §4UHV§r.
Any Green Lenses
RAM Chips

The first of many coils. Each tier of coil has better stats that impact multiple machines. Make sure to take a look at the tooltips.
All recipes in the EBF have both a minimum coil and energy tier requirement. If these conditions are not met, the EBF won't operate.
Earliest way to make this is by using an extractor.
Tin Alloy
These §bMV§r machines will allow you to process more things. Most notably you can start to break down those fluids from your §7Void Extractor
Better Processing Machines
There are multiple ways to make lubricant, maybe you can make use of all that excess creosote.
Lubricant Production
Best thing for cutting that you can get.
Lubricant

Industrial Revolution
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest1.descr: Building your first multiblock may seem daunting, but don't fret as there's an easy guide for any multiblock through EMI!
By looking at the uses of a multiblock controller in EMI, you will be shown every block needed with the amount alongside a physical display that you can look at layer by layer to help you build it.
Most multiblocks can accept multiple input bus/hatches however there is a minimum to casings a machine needs so if yours isn't forming then try replacing some of them with casing.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest10.desc: EMI/JEI has its own integration into GregTech that allows the user to more easily figure out recipes like,
§5-§r The minimum voltage tier of the recipe being on the bottom right
§5-§r Allowing you to see the speed of the recipe at each voltage tier
§5-§r Showing the speeds for Perfect Overclocking
§5-§r Having a preview of every multiblock in the pack
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest11.desc: Many GregTech machines include a circuit configuration window in the bottom-left of the interface. Circuits, ranging from Blank to 32, determine which recipes the machine can process.
To check the required circuit for a recipe, click the arrow between the input and output slots to view the machine's recipe list.
If a recipe shows no circuit or a blank one, select Blank. If it specifies a numbered circuit (e.g., 4), select the corresponding circuit in the configuration window.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest12.desc: Some GregTech machines support multiple modes, which you can switch using the window on the left side of the UI. This allows one machine to perform different tasks.
The first machine you'll encounter with this functionality is the Wooden Barrel
When changing modes, make sure to update the machine (by removing and reinserting inputs) so recipes work correctly.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest13.desc: Parallels are a mechanic that allow machines to run multiples of the same recipe at once, dramatically increasing throughput. Though how they work is a little funky.
2^(#ofOverclocks) : Time Increase Multiplier of the Recipe
%%amp : %% of an amp the recipe consumes at its tier, typically close to 100%% or 50%%, but not always.
#ofOverclocks : The number of voltage tiers your machine's §e§oSpeed§r is above the recipe's required voltage.
ParallelHatchSize = Maximum number of Parallels a Hatch can Perform (4, 16, 64, ...)
Parallel Hatches work by consuming the maximum amperage of a tier and using that to determine how many recipes can run in parallel (given your parallel hatch is large enough).
A common misconception is that using two 4A or two 16A hatches to get 8A and 32A respectively will do anything. It won't. All that does is give machines a larger buffer, &4&lNOT&r greater abilities.

Another thing to note: since multiple recipes run at once, the process will take slightly longer per batch. However, this tradeoff is worthwhile since every 4x increase in parallels nets 2x more efficiency.
An equation to calculate the max number of parallels and time increase at any tier is on the §n§oNext Page§r.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest14.desc: Dreamlinks are a form of wireless power unique to StarT
- Paragon of the Veil: Unlimited Range and Cross-Dimensional
The only form of power Dreamlinks accept are lasers. To produce these, use an active transformer.
To transfer power, you need Dream-link Nodes. These provide a kind of reception, that dream link hatches/covers accept.
By putting your Node and Hatch on the same network, they will share power, just like Flux Networks.
Each new tier of node has better range than the previous one.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest2.descr: If you are running low on resources but want to speed up production, you can use one side of an already existing multiblock and build a second one off of it!
You can share almost any blocks in a multiblock including coils and input/output buses and hatches. The item's tooltip will say if a block cannot be shared.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest3.descr: Worried your multiblock extruder is going to use the wrong cast? Well there's a feature to stop that!
If you enable distinct buses on every input bus on a multiblock then it will separate the ingredients that's stored in each one.
This means that if you insert a material into the bus with a certain cast, it can only ever use that cast and never any in other buses.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest3.title: Distinct Buses
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest4.descr: If you put two Energy Hatches onto a multiblock, it will allow you to "Overclock" the machine to the next voltage tier.
This is used quite a lot in the EBF to give you access to the next voltage tier of material but can be used on almost any other multiblock.
Examples of multiblocks that cannot form with two energy hatches is the Circuit and Normal Assembler to not allow progress skipping.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest5.descr: When using a multiblock version of a single block, you have the option to "Perfect Overclock" the machine.
You can access this in the same way as a normal Overclock however it will decrease the processing time even more!
To see the speeds when Perfect Overclocking, do Shift + Left Click on the voltage button on the bottom of the recipe on EMI
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest6.descr: One benefit of gaining access to the Large Chemical Reactor (LCR) is that you now have access to some chemical skips.
Every recipe in this multiblock that uses Circuit 24 will usually only use the base chemicals which will allow you to compact long chemical lines down into a single machine.
A few examples of this is most acids, and liquid epoxy.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest7.descr: Fluid Output hatches have the power to be locked to only accept a certain fluid. This can be useful in multiblocks like the Large Chemical Reactor and the Distillation Tower which usually will have multiple fluids being made in the same machine.
You can use this to have processing lines without fluids going to the wrong machine or the wrong tank and stopping the machine.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest8.descr: Each voltage tier has a cable material that is counted as a super conductor, which means there is no energy loss on a line of cables as well as being able to hold a higher amount of amperage.
§aUEV:§r Ancient Runicalium and Seaborgium Palladium Enriched Estalt Flerovium Alloy
GregTech also adds its own superconductors. These however are much harder to craft, and mostly get ignored because of this.
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.quest9.descr: Throughout progression, you may want to check back at older circuit tiers to see if you have gained access to a more efficient recipe.
This could be upgrading from basic components to SMD components or advanced SMD components, or gaining access to a new wafer type that can change the entire recipe.
Not only are these recipes cheaper, but they usually give a much higher quantity per craft for both components AND circuits
ftbquests.chapter.mechanics.title: Mechanics
ftbquests.chapter.mystical_agriculture_g: Currently best used for Nether Stars and Airs

Both Lithium Persulfate Dust and Sodium Persulfate Dust can be additionally required by using the opposing liquid allowing you to recycle the catalyst infinitely as long as the respective Lithium/Sodium is available.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest1.descripti: The Stirling dynamo is a furnace that generates power.

It consumes furnace fuels, and gives power in exchange. Although it is not a strong source of energy, it is an easy and relatively cheap generator, making it a popular choice for people who want to quickly get some power for LV.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest105.descrip: This is the final capacitor container.
It can be used for the UV and UHV capacitors, which includes the Ultimate Capacitor.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest105.subtitl: The third and final tier of capacitor containers
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest106.descrip: This one can be used to craft the LuV and ZPM capacitors.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest106.subtitl: The second tier of capacitor containers
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest107.descrip: The first of three capacitor containers or hulls.
This one is used for EV and IV capacitors.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest107.subtitl: The first tier of capacitor containers
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest119.descrip: §l§4I said not to worry about it.§r
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest12.descript: By right-clicking a thermal dynamo with a Steam Pipe you can convert it into a Boiler.
Boilers produce steam instead of energy, and you can use this steam to power steam generators.
Thermal offers you the Steam Dynamo, and GT offers Steam Turbines to convert steam into energy.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest12.subtitle: Generates twice as much as dynamos
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest12.title: Boilers \§ the Steam Dynamo
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest125.descrip: Parallels can make it scale just a "little".
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest13.descript: Thermal Dynamos are cheaper than GregTech energy generation machines.
Depending on the upgrades installed, you can get more power from a fuel than GregTech generators.
Best for early game up to mid game.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest133.descrip: While expensive to make and not your best source it is free energy from the §e§lSUN§r.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest134.descrip: The Supreme Plasma Turbine is a beast of a machine, capable of generating insane amounts of power.
The main focus of the SPT is reducing the spam of plasma turbines. In exchange for the insane amounts of power produced, it eats through an equally insane amount of plasma.
The SPT is most definitely worth it, especially if you apply coolant boosting.
§4Note:§7If the Machine has issues forming, break and re-place the controller
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest135.descrip: A compressed form of the T7 solar panel, to reduce the lag produced by large amounts of solar panels.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest14.descript: Higher tier generators can generate much more energy per tick than Thermal Dynamos.
Best for late mid-game and end game.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest19.descript: Plasma Turbines can use the heat of plasma's to generate large amounts of energy.
By using fusion reactors, you can generate a variety of plasma's, each with different energy efficiencies.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest2.descripti: Lapidary Dynamo's are a popular source of power. Most people power them with diamonds, and supply those with mechanical sieves.
They can take you quite far if you keep upgrading them, especially if you turn them into Boilers later on.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest20.descript: A simple Turbine that turns steam into energy.
Get steam by using boilers from either GT or Thermal.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest23.descript: Combustion Generators burn a variety of fuels to produce energy.
Most of these fuels are easily mass producible if you have oil processing up and running.
If you do not have oil processing, consider looking into Biodiesel instead
§7Keep in mind that combustion generators only accept GT Biodiesel, because the Crude Biodiesel produced by create is not refined enough to be used in these machines.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest26.descript: Gas Turbines are slightly more advanced turbines that generate energy using various gasses.
The most popular choice of these is Nitrobenzene. If you are interested in using Gas Turbines to power your base, check it out.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest29.descript: Multi-Cycle Injectors (MCI's for short) boost the fuel efficiency of your Dynamo's, making them consume less fuel.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest3.descripti: The Compression Dynamo is Thermals equivalent of the Combustion Generator from GT.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest33.descript: Auxiliary Reaction Chambers (ARC's for short) boost the maximum energy generation of a Dynamo at the cost of fuel efficiency.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest37.descript: The Redstone Flux Cell is a simple way to store some of your excess RF in the early game.
It can be upgraded using upgrade kits, and RF coil kits.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest38.descript: Expanded RF Coils (RFC's for short) provide a large boost to the internal energy capacity of a flux cell at the cost of a lower boost to energy transfer limits.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest39.descript: Stabilized RF Coils (RFS' for short) provide a medium-sized boost to both energy transfer limits and the internal energy capacity of a flux cell.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest40.descript: High-flux RF Coils (RFT's for short) provide a large boost to energy transfer limits of a flux cell at the cost of a lower boost to the internal energy capacity.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest46.descript: Active Transformers can send and receive lasers.
They accept both laser and substation hatches, and act as a transformer between "normal" EU and lasers.
These lasers can carry extremely large amounts of energy, at the cost of needing Active Transformers to both turn corners and convert lasers into usable energy.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest47.descript: The first of many energy cores. The later tiers of these take a while to make, so it is advised you plan your production of them if you are gonna rely on solar for power.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest80.descript: The base ingredient for all flux networks components, giving you access to wireless power.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest81.descript: The controller, although not necessary for your flux network to operate, allows you to use wireless charging.
No longer will you fall out of the sky because of empty jetboots, or lose access to AE2 because your terminal ran out of power.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest82.descript: A small amount of wireless power storage.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest83.descript: Flux plugs are the input nodes of your flux network. They take energy from converters and generators and store it in the... energy cloud?
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest84.descript: Flux points are the output nodes of your flux network, that provide your machines and converters with power.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest85.descript: A slightly bigger storage for your wireless power.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest86.descript: A medium sized amount of storage, perfect for storing energy until you get access to the substation.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest87.descript: Diatrons are the best lapidary dynamo fuel. Even the lowest tier of diatrons has energy-positive production!
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest87.title: Diatrons
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest90.descript: Upgrade Kits boost all stats of thermal machines.
Some machines that might benefit from these upgrades are:
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest93.descript: On top of its inherent &b10% efficiency bonus&r &7([1-.1] or .9 or 90% fuel consumption)&r, each tier up of rotor holder doubles consumption and power giving you a &62x energy&r output for 1.8x more fuel. It is always worth it if you can supply enough fuel.
In other words, it doubles parallels and gives more efficiency.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest95.descript: Generator Coils generate electricity by using a magnetic field. The faster they spin, the more FE/t they will generate, but with higher SU costs.
The Carbon Brushes must touch one of the coils in order to store the energy.
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest96.descript: Magnets are what actually makes your coils generate power. Higher Magnetic force means higher FE generation, at the cost of an increase in SU usage.
To calculate the amount of FE you produce, and how much SU that will take, you can use the following formulas:
RPM: the rotational speed of the coil
MF: the sum of the magnetic force of all magnets that influence the coil
ftbquests.chapter.power.quest97.descript: Early power transfer over long distances but can be limited.
ftbquests.chapter.power.title: Power

A singular §o§dNether Star§r can be broken down into 5 shards. Using this you can more cheaply loop them.
With an Autoclave at §9IV§r, you can higher chances at getting your elemental infused shards by using the nether star shards and energizing them in a Polarizer.
At §4UHV§r you can guarantee infused shards by using energized elemental fluids, which you can get from fusion reactors.
While there are multiple ways to do this, for demonstration purposes this method is shown.

Once you reach the Nether, you can create the most efficient Nether Star line using your §2UIV§r tier autoclave and the nether tempered elemental fluids, where, not only are you guaranteed to get infused shards, but have a chance to get extra!
Sulfuric acid is used in a ton of recipes. Once you have sufficient resource generation, automating this on passive is a must.
Sodalite and Clay electrolysis are both great ways to automate this once you have §bMV§r electrolyzers
Processing Ilmenite or Bauxite gives Rutile as byproduct, and you can electrolyze the Bauxite dust or process Ilmenite for more Rutile yield.
By electrolyzing the Purified Debris Dust that you get you are able to obtain the Debris Dust to kick off the processing chain again, thus looping the system.
Electron with Electron yields the most
Muon with Muon yields the most
Tau with Tau yields the most
While not needed yet, if you balance all the Akreyrium Variants you can recombine them and process down Lepton Dense Akreyrium for the highest yields.
This entire processing line requires a Sterile Cleanroom
Try using the Aquatic Entangler to automate this. If it is too slow, you can upgrade it with the Upgrade Kits you made before. These increase the amount of fish per catch by quite a bit.

ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest1.descrip: Star Technology is one of the first GregTech Modern packs! Embark on a journey to create many stargates, simulate microuniverses and develop technology!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest10.descri: This works if cheats are enabled. If you don't have them enabled, temporarily enable them before claiming this quest.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest10.title: Turn off AE2 Channels
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest2.descrip: Red screens flash and alarms are going off. Everyone in the room is evacuating. The experiment is a failure. There is little time before this building will explode. But you notice something... the gate ... is opening! You stare in awe and think: "Yes! My theories were right and I figured out what was the problem!". You don't notice the others calling out to you to run. But it was too late. A failure is still a failure and the gate engulfs everything in the room.

You wake up stranded on a floating island in an alternate dimension. The only things you have is a tree and some dirt around it. But you are not discouraged. As the world's greatest scientist you can use these materials to develop technology at faster rate than anyone. You can try once again interdimensional travel. For that you will have to make from almost nothing everything, to develop up to draconic and even star technology. You §oWILL§r succeed. You §oWILL§r return home.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest3.descrip: §cALPHA 1§r (Initial Release): Gameplay is in a working state. Theoretically it should be able to reach UHV. Done an initial gregification of some mods. No end game content yet.

§cBeta 2§r: Updated Forge version. Added the following mods: Architect's Palette, 'Dustrial Decor, Simple Discord RPC. Fixed Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory. Fixed some langs. Added quests chapter Quality of Life.

§cBeta 2 HOTFIX 1:§r Removed Simple Discord RPC. Fixed soul infused ingots. Made slight modifications to Quality of Life Chapter. Buffed dynamo energy generation. Made dynamo upgrades even cheaper. Added a new panorama.
§cBeta 2 HOTFIX 2:§r Re-added vanadium magnetite to sieving

§cBeta 3:§r Fixed some typos in quests. Added new quests. Tweaked the color of some casings. Tweaked lumium color. Fixed soul infused ingots recipe in Primitive Alloy Smelter. Added alloy smelter recipe for soul infused ingots. Fixed lithium perchlorate recipe. Fixed saltpeter essence burning in cryptand recipe. Fixed not being able to place blocks in Kinetic Ore Factory's area. Limited colossal chests to 5x5x5. Made nether/end agglomeratio recipes take less time. Fixed Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory infaltion issue. removed shapeless recipe for bronze and brass. Added magnetite to sieving and ore factories. Increased duration of slime spores production in Large barrel. Modified dynamo upgrades. Added new multiblock Large Stone Barrel for lava, obsidian and pebble production. Fixed netherite sieve upgrade taking HV circuits instead of IV circuits. Added crushed diamond and emerald ore to sieving. Modified create goggle recipes.
Added the following mods: Jet Boots, Pipez, Create New Age, Ender Chests, Ender Tanks, Iris and Oculus Flywheel Compat, NuclearCraft: Neoteric, Daily Dad, Forgiving Void, CraftPresence, Embeddium++.

Removed the following mods: Thermal Dynamics, Automobility, Create Slice 'n' Dice, Create Armory, Ender Storage, Extreme Reactors, Let Sleeping Dogs Lie, Modern UI, Packaged Auto, PackagedExCrafting, Ensorcellation, Corpse.

Updated the following mods: Curios API, Cyclops Core, Embeddium, FTB Quests, GTCEu Modern, Jade, Kotlin for Forge, ModernFix, Mystical Agriculture, Not Enough Crashes, Supermartijn642's Core Lib, Thermal Extra.

§cBeta 3 HOTFIX1:§r Fixed broken charges recipes. Fixed unreasonable RMPs for the Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory. Added a way to convert NuclearCraft plutonium239 and plutonium241 to their GregTech material. Removed coke to graphite recipe. Buffed chance for nether star essence in its recipe. Changed emerald and diamond crushed ore from string mesh to flint mesh.

§cBeta 3 HOTFIX 2:§r Changed carbon brushes recipe from coke to charcoal. Added Create Diesel Generators to fix the impossibility to make a proper create steam engine. Added recipe for create belts from rubber. Reduced durations of several thermal augments. Added press recipes for some materials. Changed ender pouch recipe from leather to carbon fiber plates.

§cBeta 3 HOTFIX 3:§r Added the mod Load My F***ing Tags. Fixed several recipes using double plates. Fixed NuclearCraft fuel recipes. Fixed some mystical agriculture recipes. Fixed stirling dynamo recipe.

§cALPHA 2:§r Fixed some recipes. Rearranged  and changed some quests. Fixed missing lang names of custom recipe types. Added the tree greenhouse multiblock. Added the primitive alloy smelter. Added the kinetic ore factory. Added some mods like thermal dynamics, thermal systeamics, and simply lights. Overhauled the early game.
§cALPHA 2 HOTFIX 1:§r Added the missing steam dynamo recipe. Fixed the structure of the Tree Green House. Modified the structure of quests.

§cALPHA 3:§r Added the Large Barrel multiblock. Added some quests. Added graphite, fluiduct, windowed fluiduct, servo attachment and turbo servo attachment recipes. Changed crushed blackstone recipe from forge hammer to macerator.
§cALPHA 3 HOTFIX 1:§rFixed missing gravel recipe in forge hammer. Changed sieving gem recipes from gem to crushed ore.

§cBeta 1:§r Added the following mods: Travel Anchors, Functional Storage, Item Collectors, Carry On. Made dynamos, arc upgrade, mic upgrade and components cheaper.  Buffed the Tree Greenhouse. Slightly nerfed the Extreme Reactors recipes.
§9Stargate 1 content§r: Added 6 new multiblocks. Added recipes related to the first stargate. Added appropriate quests.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quest4.descrip: We have an official discord server:
In here you can ask for help, report issues and make suggestions.
We are lucky to have a large active community, who are always willing to help, and create some insanely helpful guides.
This questbook keeps most information at a surface level, and serves more so as an introduction to all that StarT has to offer than a comprehensive and detailed guide of all systems.
For those things, we heavily recommend you check out the #guides channel in the discord.
